<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 175, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 211, 425, 260]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 722, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 211, 905, 256]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 178, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/33 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 359, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|> February/March 2021 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 285, 450]]<|/det|> Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 808, 467]]<|/det|> Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|> Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|> Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|> Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|> Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 798, 544]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 892, 575]]<|/det|> You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 320, 590]]<|/det|> You may use a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 590, 578, 606]]<|/det|> You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 635, 220, 650]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 384, 666]]<|/det|> The total mark for this paper is 40. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 729, 682]]<|/det|> The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 718, 905, 850]]<|/det|>
For Examiner's Use

Total
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 868, 611, 884]]<|/det|> This document has 12 pages.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 740, 91]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 96, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 885, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the equilibrium of a wooden rod supported by a spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 144, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 180, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 920, 167]]<|/det|>
Before assembling the apparatus, measure and record the length \(C_{\mathrm{o}}\) of the coiled section of the spring, as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[291, 175, 702, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 303, 534, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 335, 920, 353]]<|/det|>
<form>C_{\mathrm{o}} = .................................................... cm [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 365, 181, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[198, 365, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
• Assemble the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.2 with each nail held securely in a boss.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[136, 393, 856, 708]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 724, 534, 742]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 755, 210, 772]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 755, 920, 788]]<|/det|>
Adjust the bosses until the upper nail is approximately \(35 \text{cm}\) above the bench and the lower nail is approximately \(10 \text{cm}\) above the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 801, 213, 819]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 801, 824, 820]]<|/det|>
Position the string loop in one of the grooves near the middle of the rod.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 833, 213, 851]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 833, 920, 866]]<|/det|>
Adjust the free end of the string so that the rod is parallel to the bench and then secure it in the split cork.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 918, 107]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the length \(C\) of the coiled section of the spring, as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 133, 918, 151]]<|/det|>
<form>C = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 165, 492, 183]]<|/det|>
Calculate \(E\), where \(E = C - C_{\mathrm{o}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 210, 920, 228]]<|/det|>
<form>E = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 257, 180, 276]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 257, 915, 291]]<|/det|>
The distance from the centre of the lower nail to the groove with the string loop in it is x. Measure and record x.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 304, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<form>x = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 304, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Move the string loop into another groove and adjust the apparatus so that the rod is parallel to the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 306, 120]]<|/det|>
Measure C and \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 646, 152]]<|/det|>
Repeat until you have at least six sets of values of \(C\) and \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 152, 744, 177]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(E\) and \(\frac{1}{E^4}\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 562, 920, 581]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 592, 141, 610]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 592, 173, 610]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 585, 650, 612]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{E^4}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(x\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 592, 920, 611]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 623, 180, 641]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 623, 457, 641]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 623, 920, 641]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 654, 180, 673]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 654, 608, 673]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[495, 857, 917, 875]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 887, 917, 905]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 902, 920, 920]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 740, 90]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 103, 96, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 757, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the speed of air flowing through a hole.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 133, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
You are provided with a plastic bottle with the base cut off. The neck is sealed with a polythene sheet. Two lines are marked on the side of the bottle, as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[252, 175, 740, 413]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 428, 532, 446]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 459, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
The distance between the lines is \(L\), and the diameter of the bottle where the lines are marked is \(D\), as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[299, 497, 692, 636]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 650, 532, 668]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 682, 180, 700]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 682, 440, 700]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(L\) and \(D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 714, 920, 732]]<|/det|>
<form>L = ...................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 836, 920, 853]]<|/det|>
<form>D = ............................................................ $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 851, 920, 868]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 180, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[185, 72, 604, 91]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a pin and a thin nail.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 102, 863, 121]]<|/det|>
• Make a hole through the polythene sheet using the pin, as shown in Fig. 2.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 129, 803, 288]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 304, 534, 323]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 335, 611, 353]]<|/det|>
• Measure and record the diameter \(d\) of the pin.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 380, 923, 399]]<|/det|>
<form>d = .................................................... cm [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 412, 181, 431]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 412, 648, 431]]<|/det|>
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 427, 359, 445]]<|/det|>
Show your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 599, 920, 618]]<|/det|>
<form>percentage uncertainty = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 72, 781, 91]]<|/det|>
• Submerge the bottle in the bowl so that it is completely filled with water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 175, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
Tilt the bottle until it is vertical with its lower end approximately \(1 \text{cm}\) below the water level in the bowl, as shown in Fig. 2.4.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 144, 781, 438]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[462, 453, 534, 472]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 485, 175, 503]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 485, 489, 503]]<|/det|>
The water level in the bottle will fall.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 516, 920, 549]]<|/det|>
Start the stopwatch when the water level reaches the upper line, and stop the stopwatch when the water level reaches the lower line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 562, 547, 580]]<|/det|>
Record the time \(t\) shown on the stopwatch.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 715, 920, 735]]<|/det|>
<form>t = .................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 72, 181, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 71, 724, 89]]<|/det|>
Explain whether your results support the suggested relationship.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[851, 304, 920, 323]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 335, 143, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 333, 628, 354]]<|/det|>
The speed \(S\) of the air passing through a hole is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 356, 539, 387]]<|/det|>
\[S = \frac{D^2L}{k}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 395, 500, 414]]<|/det|>
Calculate \(S\) using your second value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 551, 922, 570]]<|/det|>
<form>S = ............................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(g)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 181, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 71, 905, 89]]<|/det|>
Describe four sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 210, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>
